ringMIB.name: ringMIB

ringMIB.description: The MIB module for coriolis rings

actPhyRingCount.name: actPhyRingCount
actPhyRingCount.description: Actual number of physical rings passing through the device

actPhyRingTable.name: actPhyRingTable
actPhyRingTable.description: The actual physical ring table. The number of entries in this table is given by actPhyRingCount

actPhyRingEntry.name: actPhyRingEntry
actPhyRingEntry.description: Entry containing information about the attributes of actual physical rings passing through a device

phyRingSlotNo.name: phyRingSlotNo
phyRingSlotNo.description: The slot number for the physical ring

phyRingPortNo.name: phyRingPortNo
phyRingPortNo.description: The port number of the physical ring

actLogRingCount.name: actLogRingCount
actLogRingCount.description: Actual number of logical rings passing through the device

actLogRingTable.name: actLogRingTable
actLogRingTable.description: The actual logical ring table. The number of entries in this table is given by actLogRingCount

actLogRingEntry.name: actLogRingEntry
actLogRingEntry.description: Entry containing information about the attributes of actual logical rings passing through a device

logRingVPortNo.name: logRingVPortNo
logRingVPortNo.description: The lambda number of the logical ring if applicable, else 0

logRingElemCount.name: logRingElemCount
logRingElemCount.description: Number of Elements on this logical ring

logRingLambdaStatus.name: logRingLambdaStatus
logRingLambdaStatus.description: The status of the lambda for the logical ring

logRingProtoStatusTxt.name: logRingProtoStatusTxt
logRingProtoStatusTxt.description: The ascii text describing the protocol status of the ring

logRingProtoStatus.name: logRingProtoStatus
logRingProtoStatus.description: The protocol status of the logical ring

logRingGneName.name: logRingGneName
logRingGneName.description: The name of the GNE on the ring.

logRingGneIpAddr.name: logRingGneIpAddr
logRingGneIpAddr.description: The IP address of the GNE on the ring.

logRingGneRingSlot.name: logRingGneRingSlot
logRingGneRingSlot.description: The slot of the connected GNE ring.

logRingGneRingPort.name: logRingGneRingPort
logRingGneRingPort.description: The port of the connected GNE ring.

logRingGneRingVport.name: logRingGneRingVport
logRingGneRingVport.description: The virtual port of the connected GNE ring.

logRingUpsNgbrName.name: logRingUpsNgbrName
logRingUpsNgbrName.description: The name of the upstream neighbor on the ring.

logRingUpsNgbrIpAddr.name: logRingUpsNgbrIpAddr
logRingUpsNgbrIpAddr.description: The IP address of the upstream neighbor on the ring.

logRingUpsNgbrRingSlot.name: logRingUpsNgbrRingSlot
logRingUpsNgbrRingSlot.description: The slot of the connected upstream neighbors ring.

logRingUpsNgbrRingPort.name: logRingUpsNgbrRingPort
logRingUpsNgbrRingPort.description: The port of the connected upstream neighbors ring.

logRingUpsNgbrRingVport.name: logRingUpsNgbrRingVport
logRingUpsNgbrRingVport.description: The virtual port of the connected upstream neighbors ring.

logRingIsConfigured.name: logRingIsConfigured
logRingIsConfigured.description: Whether this ring has been configured by NM

logRingAttRingType.name: logRingAttRingType
logRingAttRingType.description: This object provides the type of the ring.

logRingCutLocationIp.name: logRingCutLocationIp
logRingCutLocationIp.description: IP address of the element where ring is cut.

logRingCutLocationName.name: logRingCutLocationName
logRingCutLocationName.description: Name of the element where ring is cut.

logRingIsRingMaster.name: logRingIsRingMaster
logRingIsRingMaster.description: Whether this node is master on the ring.

logRingOtherSlot.name: logRingOtherSlot
logRingOtherSlot.description: The slot of the other(for working, it's protected or vice versa) ring.

logRingOtherPort.name: logRingOtherPort
logRingOtherPort.description: The port of the other(for working, it's protected or vice versa) ring.

logRingOtherVport.name: logRingOtherVport
logRingOtherVport.description: The vport of the other(for working, it's protected or vice versa) ring.

actLogRingElemTable.name: actLogRingElemTable
actLogRingElemTable.description: The actual logical ring topology table. This describes the Elements on a logical ring

actLogRingElemEntry.name: actLogRingElemEntry
actLogRingElemEntry.description: Entry containing information about the Elements on a logical ring

logRingElemIndex.name: logRingElemIndex
logRingElemIndex.description: The position of the Element on the ring starting from the transmit side of GNE

logRingElemMACAddr.name: logRingElemMACAddr
logRingElemMACAddr.description: The MAC address of the Element

logRingElemIpAddr.name: logRingElemIpAddr
logRingElemIpAddr.description: The IP address of the Element

logRingElemPortId.name: logRingElemPortId
logRingElemPortId.description: The port id for the logical ring on this NE

logRingElemChassisId.name: logRingElemChassisId
logRingElemChassisId.description: The chassis identifier of the Element

logRingElemActiveMM.name: logRingElemActiveMM
logRingElemActiveMM.description: The active management module of the Element

logRingElemIsInNeTable.name: logRingElemIsInNeTable
logRingElemIsInNeTable.description: Indicates whether this element has it's entry in the cfgNeTable

logRingElemIsReachable.name: logRingElemIsReachable
logRingElemIsReachable.description: Indicates whether this element is reachable on this ring.

logRingElemIsLambdaCutHere.name: logRingElemIsLambdaCutHere
logRingElemIsLambdaCutHere.description: Indicates whether there is a lambda cut at this element.

logRingElemChassisCharacter.name: logRingElemChassisCharacter
logRingElemChassisCharacter.description: The chassis character of the element.

logRingElemNodeId.name: logRingElemNodeId
logRingElemNodeId.description: The node id of the element on the ring. Value 64 means element doesn't have node id.

logRingElemRxSegCutSeverity.name: logRingElemRxSegCutSeverity
logRingElemRxSegCutSeverity.description: The cut severity of RX segement of this element on the ring. Cut severity indicates the effect of cutting RX segment on service level. noLoss => segment doesn't carry any user traffic sonetProtection => segment carries user traffic but 50ms restoration is available if segment is cut. serviceAffecting => segment carries user traffic but 50ms restoration is not available. This could be because of either ring is configured in unprotected mode or existing cut in the ring.

cfgRingTable.name: cfgRingTable
cfgRingTable.description: The configured ring table. The number of entries in this table is given by cfgRingCount

cfgRingEntry.name: cfgRingEntry
cfgRingEntry.description: Entry containing information about the attributes of configured rings passing through a device

cfgRingRowStatus.name: cfgRingRowStatus
cfgRingRowStatus.description: The row status variable. In order to modify the attributes of the ring ring has to be put in out-of-service first.

cfgRingAdminCost.name: cfgRingAdminCost
cfgRingAdminCost.description: Admin cost of the ring. In the normal case, all rings should have same admin cost. Whenever a ring is needed to be serviced, increase the admin cost of the ring. This would force the GNE to move off TCs one by one of the ring if there is alternate path available with lower admin cost. This way there will not be a sudden disruption in the case where you bring the ring down suddenly.

cfgRingName.name: cfgRingName
cfgRingName.description: The name of the configured ring

cfgRingMeshFactor.name: cfgRingMeshFactor
cfgRingMeshFactor.description: Traffic pattern on ring. The value varies between 1 (in case of hub traffic pattern)and n/2 (in case of mesh traffic pattern) where n is number of nodes in ring. This describes the inter-connection topology between nodes of the ring. Internally this factor is multiplied by n-1 to get the number of inter-connections between nodes of the ring.

cfgRingEirOverSub.name: cfgRingEirOverSub
cfgRingEirOverSub.description: Over subscription percentage on EIR portion of BW allocated on ring

cfgRingProtectMode.name: cfgRingProtectMode
cfgRingProtectMode.description: The protection mode of the ring

cfgRingExceptNes.name: cfgRingExceptNes
cfgRingExceptNes.description: Comma separated list of IP address that are physically present on the ring but no connections are allowed to be setup. This is useful for traffic management where there is a bandwidth crunch on the ring. But some of the NEs on that particular ring have alternate paths through the other rings.

cfgRingNeTopo.name: cfgRingNeTopo
cfgRingNeTopo.description: Desired topology of the ring (starting from transmit direction) in the form of comma separated list of IP addresses. If the actual topology mismatches with the desired topology, an event get generated.

cfgRingIpMode.name: cfgRingIpMode
cfgRingIpMode.description: Source of ip addresses of NEs. If it is gneSupplied, GNE over writes the ip address of NE from its configured tables. Otherwise it takes it from NE itself

cfgRingFrameMode.name: cfgRingFrameMode
cfgRingFrameMode.description: The frame mode on the ring

cfgRingOperStatus.name: cfgRingOperStatus
cfgRingOperStatus.description: The operational status of the configured ring

cfgRingCurNumTdmCkts.name: cfgRingCurNumTdmCkts
cfgRingCurNumTdmCkts.description: The number of TDM ckts traversing on the ring currently.

cfgRingCurNumFreeChans.name: cfgRingCurNumFreeChans
cfgRingCurNumFreeChans.description: The number of free channels available on the ring currently.

cfgRingNeAdminCost.name: cfgRingNeAdminCost
cfgRingNeAdminCost.description: The NE specific admin costs on the ring as comma separated list where list entry is of form <ip address in dotted notation>:<admin cost>. Admin costs for the NE's that are present on this ring but not specified in this list are inherited from ring admin cost. Admin cost per NE per ring is useful in traffic management

cfgRingCurNumDataCkts.name: cfgRingCurNumDataCkts
cfgRingCurNumDataCkts.description: The number of data ckts traversing on the ring currently.

cfgRingCurAllocTdmBwKbits.name: cfgRingCurAllocTdmBwKbits
cfgRingCurAllocTdmBwKbits.description: The bandwidth on the ring that is currently being reserved by TDM ckts passing through ring.

cfgRingCurAllocCirBwKbits.name: cfgRingCurAllocCirBwKbits
cfgRingCurAllocCirBwKbits.description: The bandwidth on the ring that is currently being reserved for CIR by data ckts passing through the ring.

cfgRingCurAllocEirBwKbits.name: cfgRingCurAllocEirBwKbits
cfgRingCurAllocEirBwKbits.description: The bandwidth on the ring that is currently being reserved for EIR by data ckts passing through the ring.

cfgRingCurAvailBwKbits.name: cfgRingCurAvailBwKbits
cfgRingCurAvailBwKbits.description: The current available bandwidth on the ring

cfgRingTdmAvgUtilPercent.name: cfgRingTdmAvgUtilPercent
cfgRingTdmAvgUtilPercent.description: Average ring utilization for TDM traffic since last reset

cfgRingTdmLastUtilPercent.name: cfgRingTdmLastUtilPercent
cfgRingTdmLastUtilPercent.description: Ring utilization for TDM traffic during last period.

cfgRingTdmMaxUtilPercent.name: cfgRingTdmMaxUtilPercent
cfgRingTdmMaxUtilPercent.description: Max. ring utilization for TDM traffic since last reset

cfgRingDataAvgUtilPercent.name: cfgRingDataAvgUtilPercent
cfgRingDataAvgUtilPercent.description: Average ring utilization for Data traffic since last reset

cfgRingDataLastUtilPercent.name: cfgRingDataLastUtilPercent
cfgRingDataLastUtilPercent.description: Ring utilization for Data traffic during last period

cfgRingDataMaxUtilPercent.name: cfgRingDataMaxUtilPercent
cfgRingDataMaxUtilPercent.description: Max. ring utilization for Data traffic since last reset

cfgRingTotalAvgUtilPercent.name: cfgRingTotalAvgUtilPercent
cfgRingTotalAvgUtilPercent.description: Average ring utlization for combined Data and TDM traffic

cfgRingTotalLastUtilPercent.name: cfgRingTotalLastUtilPercent
cfgRingTotalLastUtilPercent.description: Ring utilization for TDM and Data traffic during last period

cfgRingTotalMaxUtilPercent.name: cfgRingTotalMaxUtilPercent
cfgRingTotalMaxUtilPercent.description: Max. ring utilization for TDM and Data traffic since last reset

cfgRingTdmTrafficKbits.name: cfgRingTdmTrafficKbits
cfgRingTdmTrafficKbits.description: TDM traffic transmitted on ring since last reset

cfgRingTdmLastTrafficKbits.name: cfgRingTdmLastTrafficKbits
cfgRingTdmLastTrafficKbits.description: TDM traffic transmitted on ring during current period

cfgRingDataTrafficKbits.name: cfgRingDataTrafficKbits
cfgRingDataTrafficKbits.description: Data traffic transmitted on ring since last reset

cfgRingDataLastTrafficKbits.name: cfgRingDataLastTrafficKbits
cfgRingDataLastTrafficKbits.description: Data traffic trasnmitted on ring during last period

cfgRingDataNumPkts.name: cfgRingDataNumPkts
cfgRingDataNumPkts.description: Number of Data packets on ring since last reset

cfgRingDataLastNumPkts.name: cfgRingDataLastNumPkts
cfgRingDataLastNumPkts.description: Number of Data packets on ring during last period

cfgRingStatsCollElapsedTime.name: cfgRingStatsCollElapsedTime
cfgRingStatsCollElapsedTime.description: The time elapsed since the beginning of collection of ring statistics

cfgRingStatsPeriodTime.name: cfgRingStatsPeriodTime
cfgRingStatsPeriodTime.description: The period of status collection interval

cfgRingTimeSinceLastOperStatusChange.name: cfgRingTimeSinceLastOperStatusChange
cfgRingTimeSinceLastOperStatusChange.description: The time since the last change in the oper status of the ring

cfgRingTdmMinUtilPercent.name: cfgRingTdmMinUtilPercent
cfgRingTdmMinUtilPercent.description: Mininum ring utilization for TDM traffic since last reset

cfgRingDataMinUtilPercent.name: cfgRingDataMinUtilPercent
cfgRingDataMinUtilPercent.description: Mininum ring utilization for data traffic since last reset

cfgRingTotalMinUtilPercent.name: cfgRingTotalMinUtilPercent
cfgRingTotalMinUtilPercent.description: Mininum ring utilization for combined TDM and Data traffic since last reset

cfgRingAttUpsrSwitchCmd.name: cfgRingAttUpsrSwitchCmd
cfgRingAttUpsrSwitchCmd.description: This object defines the UPSR switch commands that amy be configured. These commands are configurable and static. The priority of the commands in relation to APS and revertive switching is given in the enumeration above.

cfgRingIsRevertiveModeEnabled.name: cfgRingIsRevertiveModeEnabled
cfgRingIsRevertiveModeEnabled.description: If the revertive mode is enabled and the UPSR switch command is clear, then, if the working ring gets cut, the traffic is moved to the protected ring. When the working ring is restored from the cut, traffic will be reverted to the working ring.

cfgRingWaitToRestorePeriod.name: cfgRingWaitToRestorePeriod
cfgRingWaitToRestorePeriod.description: This object provide the time period in minutes between the time the working ring gets restored from the cut and the time when the traffic is reverted to the working ring.

cfgRingCurTdmAvailBwKbits.name: cfgRingCurTdmAvailBwKbits
cfgRingCurTdmAvailBwKbits.description: The current tdm available bandwidth on the ring

cfgRingCurDataAvailBwKbits.name: cfgRingCurDataAvailBwKbits
cfgRingCurDataAvailBwKbits.description: The current pkt available bandwidth on the ring

ringOperStatusChange.name: ringOperStatusChange
ringOperStatusChange.description: change in operational status of a configured logical ring

neReachabilityChange.name: neReachabilityChange
neReachabilityChange.description: change in the reachability status of NE

lambdaStatusChange.name: lambdaStatusChange
lambdaStatusChange.description: change in the fiber status of the ring
